data.name: Bulbasaur
data.bio: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

data.name: Ivysaur
data.bio: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower’s coming bloom.

data.name: Venusaur
data.bio: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

data.name: Charmander
data.bio: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

data.name: Charmeleon
data.bio: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

data.name: Charizard
data.bio: It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

data.name: Squirtle
data.bio: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Wartortle
data.bio: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

data.name: Blastoise
data.bio: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

data.name: Caterpie
data.bio: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

data.name: Metapod
data.bio: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

data.name: Butterfree
data.bio: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

data.name: Weedle
data.bio: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

data.name: Kakuna
data.bio: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

data.name: Beedrill
data.bio: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

data.name: Pidgey
data.bio: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

data.name: Pidgeotto
data.bio: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

data.name: Pidgeot
data.bio: By flapping its wings with all its might, Pidgeot can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

data.name: Rattata
data.bio: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

data.name: Raticate
data.bio: It whittles its constantly growing fangs by gnawing on hard things. It can chew apart cinder walls.

data.name: Spearow
data.bio: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

data.name: Fearow
data.bio: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

data.name: Ekans
data.bio: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

data.name: Arbok
data.bio: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.

data.name: Pikachu
data.bio: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

data.name: Raichu
data.bio: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

data.name: Sandshrew
data.bio: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

data.name: Sandslash
data.bio: It curls up, then rolls into foes with its back. Its sharp spines inflict severe damage.

data.name: Nidoran♀
data.bio: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from barbs can be fatal.

data.name: Nidorina
data.bio: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino’s.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.bio: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

data.name: Nidoran♂
data.bio: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

data.name: Nidorino
data.bio: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

data.name: Nidoking
data.bio: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

data.name: Clefairy
data.bio: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

data.name: Clefable
data.bio: It is very wary and rarely shows itself to people. Its ears can hear a pin drop over half a mile away.

data.name: Vulpix
data.bio: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

data.name: Ninetales
data.bio: Its nine tails are said to be imbued with a mystic power. It can live for a thousand years.

data.name: Jigglypuff
data.bio: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

data.name: Wigglytuff
data.bio: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

data.name: Zubat
data.bio: It checks its surroundings and location using reflections of the ultrasonic waves from its mouth.

data.name: Golbat
data.bio: Its sharp fangs puncture the toughest of hides and have small holes for greedily sucking blood.

data.name: Oddish
data.bio: It often plants its root feet in the ground during the day and sows seeds as it walks about at night.

data.name: Gloom
data.bio: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.

data.name: Vileplume
data.bio: Its petals are the largest in the world. As it walks, it scatters extremely allergenic pollen.

data.name: Paras
data.bio: Mushrooms named tochukaso grow on its back. They grow along with the host Paras.

data.name: Parasect
data.bio: A mushroom grown larger than the host’s body controls Parasect. It scatters poisonous spores.

data.name: Venonat
data.bio: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

data.name: Venomoth
data.bio: It flutters its wings to scatter dustlike scales. The scales leach toxins if they contact skin.

data.name: Diglett
data.bio: A Pokémon that lives underground. Because of its dark habitat, it is repelled by bright sunlight.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.bio: Its three heads move alternately, driving it through tough soil to depths of over 60 miles.

data.name: Meowth
data.bio: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

data.name: Persian
data.bio: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

data.name: Psyduck
data.bio: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.

data.name: Golduck
data.bio: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

data.name: Mankey
data.bio: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

data.name: Primeape
data.bio: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

data.name: Growlithe
data.bio: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

data.name: Arcanine
data.bio: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

data.name: Poliwag
data.bio: Its skin is so thin, its internal organs are visible. It has trouble walking on its newly grown feet.

data.name: Poliwhirl
data.bio: The spiral pattern on its belly subtly undulates. Staring at it gradually causes drowsiness.

data.name: Poliwrath
data.bio: With its extremely tough muscles, it can keep swimming in the Pacific Ocean without resting.

data.name: Abra
data.bio: Using its psychic power is such a strain on its brain that it needs to sleep for 18 hours a day.

data.name: Kadabra
data.bio: It stares at its silver spoon to focus its mind. It emits more alpha waves while doing so.

data.name: Alakazam
data.bio: The spoons clutched in its hands are said to have been created by its psychic powers.

data.name: Machop
data.bio: Though small in stature, it is powerful enough to easily heft and throw a number of Geodude at once.

data.name: Machoke
data.bio: It happily carries heavy cargo to toughen up. It willingly does hard work for people.

data.name: Machamp
data.bio: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

data.name: Bellsprout
data.bio: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

data.name: Weepinbell
data.bio: A Pokémon that appears to be a plant. It captures unwary prey by dousing them with a toxic powder.

data.name: Victreebel
data.bio: It pools in its mouth a fluid with a honeylike scent, which is really an acid that dissolves anything.

data.name: Tentacool
data.bio: Because its body is almost entirely composed of water, it shrivels up if it is washed ashore.

data.name: Tentacruel
data.bio: It extends its 80 tentacles to form an encircling poisonous net that is difficult to escape.

data.name: Geodude
data.bio: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.

data.name: Graveler
data.bio: It rolls on mountain paths to move. Once it builds momentum, no Pokémon can stop it without difficulty.

data.name: Golem
data.bio: Even dynamite can’t harm its hard, boulderlike body. It sheds its hide just once a year.

data.name: Ponyta
data.bio: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

data.name: Rapidash
data.bio: When at an all-out gallop, its blazing mane sparkles, enhancing its beautiful appearance.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.bio: Although slow, it is skilled at fishing with its tail. It does not feel pain if its tail is bitten.

data.name: Slowbro
data.bio: Though usually dim witted, it seems to become inspired if the Shellder on its tail bites down.

data.name: Magnemite
data.bio: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.

data.name: Magneton
data.bio: Many mysteriously appear when more sunspots dot the sun. They stop TV sets from displaying properly.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.bio: It can’t live without the stalk it holds. That’s why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

data.name: Doduo
data.bio: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

data.name: Dodrio
data.bio: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

data.name: Seel
data.bio: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.

data.name: Dewgong
data.bio: In snow, the pure white coat covering its body obscures it from predators.

data.name: Grimer
data.bio: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon’s X-rays. It appears among filth.

data.name: Muk
data.bio: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.

data.name: Shellder
data.bio: It swims backward by opening and closing its two shells. Its large tongue is always kept hanging out.

data.name: Cloyster
data.bio: It fights by keeping its shell tightly shut for protection and by shooting spikes to repel foes.

data.name: Gastly
data.bio: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

data.name: Haunter
data.bio: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

data.name: Gengar
data.bio: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.

data.name: Onix
data.bio: It burrows through the ground at a speed of 50 mph while feeding on large boulders.

data.name: Drowzee
data.bio: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

data.name: Hypno
data.bio: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.

data.name: Krabby
data.bio: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.

data.name: Kingler
data.bio: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is so heavy, it is difficult to aim.

data.name: Voltorb
data.bio: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

data.name: Electrode
data.bio: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.bio: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.bio: It is called “The Walking Jungle.” If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

data.name: Cubone
data.bio: When it thinks of its dead mother, it cries. Its crying makes the skull it wears rattle hollowly.

data.name: Marowak
data.bio: From its birth, this savage Pokémon constantly holds bones. It is skilled in using them as weapons.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.bio: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.bio: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

data.name: Lickitung
data.bio: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.

data.name: Koffing
data.bio: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

data.name: Weezing
data.bio: It grows by feeding on gases released by garbage. Though very rare, triplets have been found.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.bio: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.

data.name: Rhydon
data.bio: Standing on its hind legs freed its forelegs and made it smarter. It is very forgetful, however.

data.name: Chansey
data.bio: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

data.name: Tangela
data.bio: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.

data.name: Kangaskhan
data.bio: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.

data.name: Horsea
data.bio: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

data.name: Seadra
data.bio: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional medicine ingredients.

data.name: Goldeen
data.bio: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.

data.name: Seaking
data.bio: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.

data.name: Staryu
data.bio: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

data.name: Starmie
data.bio: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.bio: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.

data.name: Scyther
data.bio: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

data.name: Jynx
data.bio: Its cries sound like human speech. However, it is impossible to tell what it is trying to say.

data.name: Electabuzz
data.bio: It windmills its arms to slightly boost its punches. Foes have been known to escape in the meantime.

data.name: Magmar
data.bio: When it breathes deeply, heat waves form around its body, making it hard to see clearly.

data.name: Pinsir
data.bio: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can’t tear, it tosses far.

data.name: Tauros
data.bio: Once it takes aim at its foe, it makes a headlong charge. It is famous for its violent nature.

data.name: Magikarp
data.bio: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

data.name: Gyarados
data.bio: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

data.name: Lapras
data.bio: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

data.name: Ditto
data.bio: It has the ability to reconstitute its entire cellular structure to transform into whatever it sees.

data.name: Eevee
data.bio: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

data.name: Vaporeon
data.bio: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can melt away into water.

data.name: Jolteon
data.bio: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.

data.name: Flareon
data.bio: Inhaled air is heated in the flame sac in its body to an intense fire over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Porygon
data.bio: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.

data.name: Omanyte
data.bio: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

data.name: Omastar
data.bio: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

data.name: Kabuto
data.bio: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.

data.name: Kabutops
data.bio: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

data.name: Aerodactyl
data.bio: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

data.name: Snorlax
data.bio: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

data.name: Articuno
data.bio: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

data.name: Zapdos
data.bio: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

data.name: Moltres
data.bio: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

data.name: Dratini
data.bio: It is called the “Mirage Pokémon” because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

data.name: Dragonair
data.bio: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

data.name: Dragonite
data.bio: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.bio: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew’s genes. It’s said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

data.name: Mew
data.bio: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

data.name: Chikorita
data.bio: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

data.name: Bayleef
data.bio: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.

data.name: Meganium
data.bio: Its breath has the fantastic ability to revive dead plants and flowers.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.bio: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Quilava
data.bio: It intimidates foes with the heat of its flames. The fire burns more strongly when it readies to fight.

data.name: Typhlosion
data.bio: It attacks using blasts of fire. It creates heat shimmers with intense fire to hide itself.

data.name: Totodile
data.bio: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer needs to be careful.

data.name: Croconaw
data.bio: Once it bites down, it won’t let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.

data.name: Feraligatr
data.bio: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

data.name: Sentret
data.bio: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

data.name: Furret
data.bio: The mother puts its offspring to sleep by curling up around them. It corners foes with speed.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.bio: It marks time precisely. Some countries consider it to be a wise friend, versed in the world’s ways.

data.name: Noctowl
data.bio: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

data.name: Ledyba
data.bio: It is so timid, it can’t move if it isn’t with a swarm of others. It conveys its feelings with scent.

data.name: Ledian
data.bio: It uses starlight as energy. When more stars appear at night, the patterns on its back grow larger.

data.name: Spinarak
data.bio: It sets a trap by spinning a web with thin but strong silk. It waits motionlessly for prey to arrive.

data.name: Ariados
data.bio: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.

data.name: Crobat
data.bio: The transformation of its legs into wings made it better at flying, but more clumsy at walking.

data.name: Chinchou
data.bio: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

data.name: Lanturn
data.bio: Lanturn’s light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed “The Deep-Sea Star.”

data.name: Pichu
data.bio: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.

data.name: Cleffa
data.bio: It is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies. It’s said to arrive riding on a shooting star.

data.name: Igglybuff
data.bio: It has a soft and bouncy body. Once it starts bouncing, it becomes impossible to stop.

data.name: Togepi
data.bio: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

data.name: Togetic
data.bio: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kind-hearted people.

data.name: Natu
data.bio: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

data.name: Xatu
data.bio: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

data.name: Mareep
data.bio: Its fluffy coat swells to double when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.

data.name: Flaaffy
data.bio: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

data.name: Ampharos
data.bio: The tip of its tail shines brightly. In the olden days, people sent signals using the tail’s light.

data.name: Bellossom
data.bio: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

data.name: Marill
data.bio: The oil-filled end of its tail floats on water. It keeps Marill from drowning even in a strong current.

data.name: Azumarill
data.bio: It can spend all day in water, since it can inhale and store a large volume of air.

data.name: Sudowoodo
data.bio: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.

data.name: Politoed
data.bio: It gathers groups of others as their leader. Its cries make Poliwag obey.

data.name: Hoppip
data.bio: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

data.name: Skiploom
data.bio: It blooms when the weather warms. It floats in the sky to soak up as much sunlight as possible.

data.name: Jumpluff
data.bio: Blown by seasonal winds, it circles the globe, scattering cotton spores as it goes.

data.name: Aipom
data.bio: It lives high among the treetops. It can use its tail as freely and cleverly as its hands.

data.name: Sunkern
data.bio: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. A year after a cold summer, their population explodes.

data.name: Sunflora
data.bio: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.

data.name: Yanma
data.bio: It can hover in one spot by flapping its wings at high speed. It flits about to guard its territory.

data.name: Wooper
data.bio: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

data.name: Quagsire
data.bio: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn’t care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

data.name: Espeon
data.bio: Its fur is so sensitive, it can sense minute shifts in the air and predict the weather.

data.name: Umbreon
data.bio: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

data.name: Murkrow
data.bio: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.

data.name: Slowking
data.bio: Being bitten by Shellder gave it intelligence comparable to that of award-winning scientists.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.bio: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

data.name: Unown
data.bio: When alone, nothing happens. However, if there are two or more, an odd power is said to emerge.

data.name: Wobbuffet
data.bio: It desperately tries to keep its black tail hidden. It is said to be proof the tail hides a secret.

data.name: Girafarig
data.bio: The head on its tail contains a small brain. It can instinctively fight even while facing backward.

data.name: Pineco
data.bio: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokémon that peck it by mistake.

data.name: Forretress
data.bio: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

data.name: Dunsparce
data.bio: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.

data.name: Gligar
data.bio: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.

data.name: Steelix
data.bio: It is thought its body transformed as a result of iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

data.name: Snubbull
data.bio: Small Pokémon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.

data.name: Granbull
data.bio: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

data.name: Qwilfish
data.bio: It shoots the poison spines on its body in all directions. Its round form makes it a poor swimmer.

data.name: Scizor
data.bio: It raises its pincers with eyelike markings for intimidation. It also swings them down dangerously.

data.name: Shuckle
data.bio: It stores berries in its shell. The berries eventually ferment to become delicious juices.

data.name: Heracross
data.bio: It loves sweet honey. To keep all the honey to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.

data.name: Sneasel
data.bio: A smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.

data.name: Teddiursa
data.bio: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every set of paws tastes unique.

data.name: Ursaring
data.bio: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.

data.name: Slugma
data.bio: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn’t keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Magcargo
data.bio: Its body temperature is roughly 18,000 degrees F. Flames spout from gaps in its hardened shell.

data.name: Swinub
data.bio: It has a very sensitive nose. It can locate mushrooms, berries, and even hot springs buried under ice.

data.name: Piloswine
data.bio: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is strong against the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.

data.name: Corsola
data.bio: Many live in the clean seas of the south. They apparently can’t live in polluted waters.

data.name: Remoraid
data.bio: It forcefully squirts water. The water jet never misses prey even if the Remoraid is deep in the sea.

data.name: Octillery
data.bio: It loves to lurk inside holes in rocks. It sometimes sprays ink on prey by sticking out only its mouth.

data.name: Delibird
data.bio: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.

data.name: Mantine
data.bio: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

data.name: Skarmory
data.bio: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.

data.name: Houndour
data.bio: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

data.name: Houndoom
data.bio: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.

data.name: Kingdra
data.bio: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

data.name: Phanpy
data.bio: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

data.name: Donphan
data.bio: It attacks by curling up, then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.

data.name: Porygon2
data.bio: It was upgraded to enable the exploration of other planets. However, it failed to measure up.

data.name: Stantler
data.bio: Staring at its antlers creates an odd sensation as if one were being drawn into their centers.

data.name: Smeargle
data.bio: It marks its territory by using its tail like a paintbrush. There are more than 5,000 different marks.

data.name: Tyrogue
data.bio: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.

data.name: Hitmontop
data.bio: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by ten.

data.name: Smoochum
data.bio: It tests everything by touching with its lips, which remember what it likes and dislikes.

data.name: Elekid
data.bio: A weak electric current flows between its horns. Sticking a hand there shocks the unwary.

data.name: Magby
data.bio: Its magma-like blood circulates throughout its body. Its body’s heat can top 1,100 degrees F.

data.name: Miltank
data.bio: It is said that kids who drink Miltank’s milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

data.name: Blissey
data.bio: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.

data.name: Raikou
data.bio: It is said to have fallen with lightning. It can fire thunderbolts from the rain clouds on its back.

data.name: Entei
data.bio: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

data.name: Suicune
data.bio: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

data.name: Larvitar
data.bio: A Pokémon that eats soil. Once it has eaten a large mountain, it goes to sleep so it can grow.

data.name: Pupitar
data.bio: Its body is as hard as bedrock. By venting pressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.

data.name: Tyranitar
data.bio: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

data.name: Lugia
data.bio: It sleeps in a deep-sea trench. If it flaps its wings, it is said to cause a 40-day storm.

data.name: Ho-oh
data.bio: Its feathers are in seven colors. It is said that anyone seeing it is promised eternal happiness.

data.name: Celebi
data.bio: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.

data.name: Treecko
data.bio: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

data.name: Grovyle
data.bio: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

data.name: Sceptile
data.bio: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.

data.name: Torchic
data.bio: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

data.name: Combusken
data.bio: Its kicking mastery lets it loose 10 kicks per second. It emits sharp cries to intimidate foes.

data.name: Blaziken
data.bio: Flames spout from its wrists, enveloping its knuckles. Its punches scorch its foes.

data.name: Mudkip
data.bio: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Marshtomp
data.bio: Its sturdy legs give it sure footing, even in mud. It burrows into dirt to sleep.

data.name: Swampert
data.bio: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.

data.name: Poochyena
data.bio: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

data.name: Mightyena
data.bio: It chases down prey in a pack. It will never disobey the commands of a skilled Trainer.

data.name: Zigzagoon
data.bio: It walks in zigzag fashion. It is good at finding items in the grass and even in the ground.

data.name: Linoone
data.bio: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

data.name: Wurmple
data.bio: Often targeted by bird Pokémon, it desperately resists by releasing poison from its tail spikes.

data.name: Silcoon
data.bio: It wraps silk around the branches of a tree. It drinks rainwater on its silk while awaiting evolution.

data.name: Beautifly
data.bio: Despite its looks, it is aggressive. It jabs with its long, thin mouth if disturbed while collecting pollen.

data.name: Cascoon
data.bio: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

data.name: Dustox
data.bio: Toxic powder is scattered with each flap. At night, it is known to strip leaves off trees lining boulevards.

data.name: Lotad
data.bio: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can’t swim.

data.name: Lombre
data.bio: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

data.name: Ludicolo
data.bio: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can’t help breaking out into a dance.

data.name: Seedot
data.bio: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.bio: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

data.name: Shiftry
data.bio: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.

data.name: Taillow
data.bio: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

data.name: Swellow
data.bio: It circles the sky in search of prey. When it spots one, it dives steeply to catch the prey.

data.name: Wingull
data.bio: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.

data.name: Pelipper
data.bio: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

data.name: Ralts
data.bio: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

data.name: Kirlia
data.bio: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

data.name: Gardevoir
data.bio: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

data.name: Surskit
data.bio: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.

data.name: Masquerain
data.bio: Its antennae have eye patterns on them. Its four wings enable it to hover and fly in any direction.

data.name: Shroomish
data.bio: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

data.name: Breloom
data.bio: Its short arms stretch when it throws punches. Its technique is equal to that of pro boxers.

data.name: Slakoth
data.bio: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

data.name: Vigoroth
data.bio: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still for even a moment.

data.name: Slaking
data.bio: The world’s laziest Pokémon. When it is lounging, it is actually saving energy for striking back.

data.name: Nincada
data.bio: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

data.name: Ninjask
data.bio: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

data.name: Shedinja
data.bio: A discarded bug shell that came to life. Peering into the crack on its back is said to steal one’s spirit.

data.name: Whismur
data.bio: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

data.name: Loudred
data.bio: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

data.name: Exploud
data.bio: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

data.name: Makuhita
data.bio: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

data.name: Hariyama
data.bio: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

data.name: Azurill
data.bio: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.

data.name: Nosepass
data.bio: When endangered, it may protect itself by raising its magnetism and drawing iron objects to its body.

data.name: Skitty
data.bio: It can’t stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

data.name: Delcatty
data.bio: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

data.name: Sableye
data.bio: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

data.name: Mawile
data.bio: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

data.name: Aron
data.bio: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

data.name: Lairon
data.bio: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.

data.name: Aggron
data.bio: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.

data.name: Meditite
data.bio: It always trains deep in mountains. It levitates when it heightens its spiritual power through meditation.

data.name: Medicham
data.bio: It gains the ability to see the aura of its opponents by honing its mind through starvation.

data.name: Electrike
data.bio: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

data.name: Manectric
data.bio: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Plusle
data.bio: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

data.name: Minun
data.bio: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

data.name: Volbeat
data.bio: It communicates with others by lighting up its rear at night. It loves Illumise’s sweet aroma.

data.name: Illumise
data.bio: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

data.name: Roselia
data.bio: The more healthy the Roselia, the more pleasant its flowers’ aroma. Its scent deeply relaxes people.

data.name: Gulpin
data.bio: Almost all its body is its stomach. Its harsh digestive juices quickly dissolve anything it swallows.

data.name: Swalot
data.bio: It swallows anything whole. It sweats toxic fluids from its follicles to douse foes.

data.name: Carvanha
data.bio: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

data.name: Sharpedo
data.bio: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as “The Bully of the Sea.”

data.name: Wailmer
data.bio: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.

data.name: Wailord
data.bio: The biggest of all Pokémon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.

data.name: Numel
data.bio: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

data.name: Camerupt
data.bio: It has volcanoes on its back. If magma builds up in its body, it shudders, then erupts violently.

data.name: Torkoal
data.bio: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

data.name: Spoink
data.bio: It bounces constantly, using its tail like a spring. The shock of bouncing keeps its heart beating.

data.name: Grumpig
data.bio: It uses black pearls to amplify its psycho-power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

data.name: Spinda
data.bio: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

data.name: Trapinch
data.bio: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

data.name: Vibrava
data.bio: It violently shudders its wings, generating ultrasonic waves to induce headaches in people.

data.name: Flygon
data.bio: It whips up sandstorms with powerful flaps of its wings. It is known as “The Desert Spirit.”

data.name: Cacnea
data.bio: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.

data.name: Cacturne
data.bio: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day’s desert heat.

data.name: Swablu
data.bio: It can’t relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.

data.name: Altaria
data.bio: If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.

data.name: Zangoose
data.bio: It has feuded with Seviper for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.

data.name: Seviper
data.bio: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose. It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.

data.name: Lunatone
data.bio: Because it turns active on nights of the full moon, it is said to have some link to the lunar phases.

data.name: Solrock
data.bio: A new Pokémon species, rumored to be from the sun. It gives off light while spinning.

data.name: Barboach
data.bio: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.

data.name: Whiscash
data.bio: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.

data.name: Corphish
data.bio: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.

data.name: Crawdaunt
data.bio: It is a ruffian that uses its pincers to pick up and toss out other Pokémon from its pond.

data.name: Baltoy
data.bio: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

data.name: Claydol
data.bio: An ancient clay figurine that came to life as a Pokémon from exposure to a mysterious ray of light.

data.name: Lileep
data.bio: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.

data.name: Cradily
data.bio: It lives in the shallows of warm seas. When the tide goes out, it digs up prey from beaches.

data.name: Anorith
data.bio: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

data.name: Armaldo
data.bio: It went ashore after evolving. Its entire body is clad in a sturdy armor.

data.name: Feebas
data.bio: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

data.name: Milotic
data.bio: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.

data.name: Castform
data.bio: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

data.name: Kecleon
data.bio: It can freely change its body’s color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn’t change, however.

data.name: Shuppet
data.bio: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

data.name: Banette
data.bio: A doll that became a Pokémon over its grudge from being junked. It seeks the child that disowned it.

data.name: Duskull
data.bio: It loves the crying of children. It startles bad kids by passing through walls and making them cry.

data.name: Dusclops
data.bio: It seeks drifting will-o’-the-wisps and sucks them into its empty body. What happens inside is a mystery.

data.name: Tropius
data.bio: Delicious fruits grew out from around its neck because it always ate the same kind of fruit.

data.name: Chimecho
data.bio: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.

data.name: Absol
data.bio: Rumored to sense disasters with its horn, it became a target. It fled deep into the mountains.

data.name: Wynaut
data.bio: It grows strong by pushing up against others en masse. It loves eating sweet fruit.

data.name: Snorunt
data.bio: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.

data.name: Glalie
data.bio: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.

data.name: Spheal
data.bio: It rolls across ice floes to reach shore because its body is poorly shaped for swimming.

data.name: Sealeo
data.bio: It habitually spins things on its nose. By doing so, it learns textures and odors.

data.name: Walrein
data.bio: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

data.name: Clamperl
data.bio: It makes a single pearl during its lifetime. The pearl is said to amplify psychic power.

data.name: Huntail
data.bio: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.

data.name: Gorebyss
data.bio: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.

data.name: Relicanth
data.bio: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

data.name: Luvdisc
data.bio: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

data.name: Bagon
data.bio: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

data.name: Shelgon
data.bio: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

data.name: Salamence
data.bio: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changed, and wings grew out.

data.name: Beldum
data.bio: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

data.name: Metang
data.bio: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won’t be scratched if it collides with a jet.

data.name: Metagross
data.bio: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

data.name: Regirock
data.bio: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.

data.name: Regice
data.bio: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Registeel
data.bio: Tempered by pressure underground over tens of thousands of years, its body cannot be scratched.

data.name: Latias
data.bio: Its body is covered with a down that can refract light in such a way that it becomes invisible.

data.name: Latios
data.bio: A highly intelligent Pokémon. By folding back its wings in flight, it can overtake jet planes.

data.name: Kyogre
data.bio: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

data.name: Groudon
data.bio: It had been asleep in underground magma ever since it fiercely fought Kyogre long ago.

data.name: Rayquaza
data.bio: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

data.name: Jirachi
data.bio: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.

data.name: Deoxys
data.bio: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

data.name: Turtwig
data.bio: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.

data.name: Grotle
data.bio: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

data.name: Torterra
data.bio: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra’s back and spend their entire life there.

data.name: Chimchar
data.bio: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

data.name: Monferno
data.bio: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

data.name: Infernape
data.bio: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.

data.name: Piplup
data.bio: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

data.name: Prinplup
data.bio: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

data.name: Empoleon
data.bio: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.

data.name: Starly
data.bio: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

data.name: Staravia
data.bio: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

data.name: Staraptor
data.bio: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

data.name: Bidoof
data.bio: A comparison revealed that Bidoof’s front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata’s.

data.name: Bibarel
data.bio: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.

data.name: Kricketot
data.bio: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.

data.name: Kricketune
data.bio: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

data.name: Shinx
data.bio: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

data.name: Luxio
data.bio: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Luxray
data.bio: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.

data.name: Budew
data.bio: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.

data.name: Roserade
data.bio: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.

data.name: Cranidos
data.bio: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.

data.name: Rampardos
data.bio: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.

data.name: Shieldon
data.bio: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.

data.name: Bastiodon
data.bio: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.

data.name: Burmy
data.bio: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.

data.name: Wormadam
data.bio: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.

data.name: Mothim
data.bio: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from Combee.

data.name: Combee
data.bio: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.bio: It releases various pheromones to make the grubs in its body do its bidding while fighting foes.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.bio: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

data.name: Buizel
data.bio: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

data.name: Floatzel
data.bio: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.

data.name: Cherubi
data.bio: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

data.name: Cherrim
data.bio: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.

data.name: Shellos
data.bio: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.

data.name: Gastrodon
data.bio: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.

data.name: Ambipom
data.bio: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.

data.name: Drifloon
data.bio: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”

data.name: Drifblim
data.bio: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.

data.name: Buneary
data.bio: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.

data.name: Lopunny
data.bio: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

data.name: Mismagius
data.bio: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

data.name: Honchkrow
data.bio: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”

data.name: Glameow
data.bio: It hides its spiteful tendency of hooking its claws into the nose of its Trainer if it isn’t fed.

data.name: Purugly
data.bio: It binds its body with its tails to make itself look bigger. If it locks eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.

data.name: Chingling
data.bio: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

data.name: Stunky
data.bio: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

data.name: Skuntank
data.bio: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.

data.name: Bronzor
data.bio: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.

data.name: Bronzong
data.bio: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

data.name: Bonsly
data.bio: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.

data.name: Mime Jr.
data.bio: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.

data.name: Happiny
data.bio: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others’ feet and cause them to stumble.

data.name: Chatot
data.bio: Its tongue is just like a human’s. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.bio: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

data.name: Gible
data.bio: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.

data.name: Gabite
data.bio: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

data.name: Garchomp
data.bio: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.

data.name: Munchlax
data.bio: In its desperation to gulp down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.

data.name: Riolu
data.bio: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

data.name: Lucario
data.bio: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

data.name: Hippopotas
data.bio: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.

data.name: Hippowdon
data.bio: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.

data.name: Skorupi
data.bio: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.

data.name: Drapion
data.bio: Possessing a sturdy build, it takes pride in its strength, taking down foes without using toxins.

data.name: Croagunk
data.bio: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.

data.name: Toxicroak
data.bio: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

data.name: Carnivine
data.bio: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

data.name: Finneon
data.bio: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.

data.name: Lumineon
data.bio: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with Lanturn.

data.name: Mantyke
data.bio: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with Remoraid.

data.name: Snover
data.bio: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

data.name: Abomasnow
data.bio: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

data.name: Weavile
data.bio: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

data.name: Magnezone
data.bio: A group tried to use scientific means to make Magnezone evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.

data.name: Lickilicky
data.bio: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.bio: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.bio: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.

data.name: Electivire
data.bio: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.

data.name: Magmortar
data.bio: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.

data.name: Togekiss
data.bio: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.

data.name: Yanmega
data.bio: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.

data.name: Leafeon
data.bio: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.

data.name: Glaceon
data.bio: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.

data.name: Gliscor
data.bio: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.

data.name: Mamoswine
data.bio: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.

data.name: Porygon-Z
data.bio: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.

data.name: Gallade
data.bio: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.

data.name: Probopass
data.bio: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

data.name: Dusknoir
data.bio: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

data.name: Froslass
data.bio: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

data.name: Rotom
data.bio: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.

data.name: Uxie
data.bio: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.

data.name: Mesprit
data.bio: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.

data.name: Azelf
data.bio: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.

data.name: Dialga
data.bio: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga’s heart beats.

data.name: Palkia
data.bio: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with Palkia’s every breath.

data.name: Heatran
data.bio: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.

data.name: Regigigas
data.bio: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.

data.name: Giratina
data.bio: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

data.name: Cresselia
data.bio: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.

data.name: Phione
data.bio: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

data.name: Manaphy
data.bio: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

data.name: Darkrai
data.bio: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.

data.name: Shaymin
data.bio: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.

data.name: Arceus
data.bio: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.

data.name: Victini
data.bio: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

data.name: Snivy
data.bio: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

data.name: Servine
data.bio: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

data.name: Serperior
data.bio: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

data.name: Tepig
data.bio: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Pignite
data.bio: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

data.name: Emboar
data.bio: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

data.name: Oshawott
data.bio: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

data.name: Dewott
data.bio: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

data.name: Samurott
data.bio: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

data.name: Patrat
data.bio: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

data.name: Watchog
data.bio: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

data.name: Lillipup
data.bio: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

data.name: Herdier
data.bio: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

data.name: Stoutland
data.bio: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.

data.name: Purrloin
data.bio: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

data.name: Liepard
data.bio: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.

data.name: Pansage
data.bio: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

data.name: Simisage
data.bio: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

data.name: Pansear
data.bio: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

data.name: Simisear
data.bio: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

data.name: Panpour
data.bio: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

data.name: Simipour
data.bio: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

data.name: Munna
data.bio: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

data.name: Musharna
data.bio: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

data.name: Pidove
data.bio: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

data.name: Tranquill
data.bio: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.

data.name: Unfezant
data.bio: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.

data.name: Blitzle
data.bio: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.bio: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

data.name: Roggenrola
data.bio: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

data.name: Boldore
data.bio: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

data.name: Gigalith
data.bio: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

data.name: Woobat
data.bio: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

data.name: Swoobat
data.bio: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

data.name: Drilbur
data.bio: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

data.name: Excadrill
data.bio: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

data.name: Audino
data.bio: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

data.name: Timburr
data.bio: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

data.name: Gurdurr
data.bio: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

data.name: Conkeldurr
data.bio: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

data.name: Tympole
data.bio: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.bio: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

data.name: Seismitoad
data.bio: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

data.name: Throh
data.bio: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

data.name: Sawk
data.bio: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

data.name: Sewaddle
data.bio: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

data.name: Swadloon
data.bio: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

data.name: Leavanny
data.bio: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

data.name: Venipede
data.bio: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

data.name: Whirlipede
data.bio: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

data.name: Scolipede
data.bio: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

data.name: Cottonee
data.bio: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.bio: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

data.name: Petilil
data.bio: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

data.name: Lilligant
data.bio: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

data.name: Basculin
data.bio: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

data.name: Sandile
data.bio: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

data.name: Krokorok
data.bio: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

data.name: Krookodile
data.bio: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

data.name: Darumaka
data.bio: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

data.name: Darmanitan
data.bio: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

data.name: Maractus
data.bio: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

data.name: Dwebble
data.bio: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.

data.name: Crustle
data.bio: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

data.name: Scraggy
data.bio: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

data.name: Scrafty
data.bio: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.bio: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.

data.name: Yamask
data.bio: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.bio: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

data.name: Tirtouga
data.bio: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

data.name: Carracosta
data.bio: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.

data.name: Archen
data.bio: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.

data.name: Archeops
data.bio: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.

data.name: Trubbish
data.bio: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

data.name: Garbodor
data.bio: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

data.name: Zorua
data.bio: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

data.name: Zoroark
data.bio: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

data.name: Minccino
data.bio: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

data.name: Cinccino
data.bio: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

data.name: Gothita
data.bio: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

data.name: Gothorita
data.bio: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

data.name: Gothitelle
data.bio: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

data.name: Solosis
data.bio: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

data.name: Duosion
data.bio: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

data.name: Reuniclus
data.bio: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

data.name: Ducklett
data.bio: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.

data.name: Swanna
data.bio: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

data.name: Vanillite
data.bio: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

data.name: Vanillish
data.bio: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

data.name: Vanilluxe
data.bio: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.

data.name: Deerling
data.bio: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

data.name: Sawsbuck
data.bio: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.

data.name: Emolga
data.bio: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

data.name: Karrablast
data.bio: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

data.name: Escavalier
data.bio: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.

data.name: Foongus
data.bio: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

data.name: Amoonguss
data.bio: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

data.name: Frillish
data.bio: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

data.name: Jellicent
data.bio: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

data.name: Alomomola
data.bio: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

data.name: Joltik
data.bio: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

data.name: Galvantula
data.bio: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

data.name: Ferroseed
data.bio: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

data.name: Ferrothorn
data.bio: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

data.name: Klink
data.bio: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

data.name: Klang
data.bio: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

data.name: Klinklang
data.bio: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

data.name: Tynamo
data.bio: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

data.name: Eelektrik
data.bio: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

data.name: Eelektross
data.bio: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

data.name: Elgyem
data.bio: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.

data.name: Beheeyem
data.bio: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

data.name: Litwick
data.bio: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

data.name: Lampent
data.bio: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

data.name: Chandelure
data.bio: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.

data.name: Axew
data.bio: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

data.name: Fraxure
data.bio: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.

data.name: Haxorus
data.bio: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

data.name: Cubchoo
data.bio: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.

data.name: Beartic
data.bio: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

data.name: Cryogonal
data.bio: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.

data.name: Shelmet
data.bio: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.

data.name: Accelgor
data.bio: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

data.name: Stunfisk
data.bio: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

data.name: Mienfoo
data.bio: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

data.name: Mienshao
data.bio: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

data.name: Druddigon
data.bio: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

data.name: Golett
data.bio: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

data.name: Golurk
data.bio: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

data.name: Pawniard
data.bio: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

data.name: Bisharp
data.bio: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

data.name: Bouffalant
data.bio: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

data.name: Rufflet
data.bio: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

data.name: Braviary
data.bio: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

data.name: Vullaby
data.bio: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

data.name: Mandibuzz
data.bio: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

data.name: Heatmor
data.bio: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.

data.name: Durant
data.bio: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

data.name: Deino
data.bio: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

data.name: Zweilous
data.bio: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

data.name: Hydreigon
data.bio: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.

data.name: Larvesta
data.bio: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

data.name: Volcarona
data.bio: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.

data.name: Cobalion
data.bio: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.

data.name: Terrakion
data.bio: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.

data.name: Virizion
data.bio: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

data.name: Tornadus
data.bio: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

data.name: Thundurus
data.bio: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.

data.name: Reshiram
data.bio: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

data.name: Zekrom
data.bio: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

data.name: Landorus
data.bio: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

data.name: Kyurem
data.bio: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

data.name: Keldeo
data.bio: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.

data.name: Meloetta
data.bio: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

data.name: Genesect
data.bio: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.
